content: Ravin Balakrishnan Ravin Balakrishnan Professor Department of Computer Science University of Toronto Brief Biography Publications Courses Students & Postdocs Professional Activities email: ravin at dgp.toronto.edu voice: (416) 946-3448 office: Rm BA7204, 40 St. George St, Toronto lab: Dynamic Graphics Project postal mail & courier address: Ravin Balakrishnan Department of Computer Science University of Toronto 40 St. George Street, Room 4283 Toronto, Ontario Canada M5S 2E4 Tel (for courier): 416 978-6025 Brief Biography Ravin Balakrishnan is a Professor at the Department of Computer Science, University of Toronto. He served as the departments chair from 2015-2019. His research interests are in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Information and Communications Technology for Development, and Interactive Computer Graphics. He is the recipient of an Alfred P. Sloan Research Fellowship, a Canada Research Chair, an Ontario Premier's Research Excellence Award, the Bell University Laboratories Associate Chair in HCI, the Canadian Human Computer Communications Society Achievement Award, multiple best paper type awards at the top conferences in his field, and was inducted into the ACM CHI Academy in 2011. In addition to working with students and colleagues at Toronto, he collaborates with researchers at leading industrial laboratories and universities worldwide, including stints as a visiting researcher at Mitsubishi Electric Research Laboratories (MERL), the University of Paris, INRIA Paris and Lille, Microsoft Researchs Redmond, Beijing, Bangalore and Cambridge labs, and Hewlett Packard Labs Bangalore. He has been a co-founder of several companies commercializing research conducted in his lab, including Bump Technologies (acquired by Google), FindSpace (acquired by Cougar Group), and Conceptualiz. He earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Toronto, working with Bill Buxton, while concurrently a part-time researcher at Alias|wavefront (now part of Autodesk). He actively consults for various leading companies as a testifying technical expert on intellectual property matters in multiple countries.
